pressure release ventilation countered undesirable alveolar collapse in dependent lung regions, resulting in end-expiratory aeration. a multi-centre trial of the safety and efficacy of high-frequency oscillatory ventilation (HFOV) in ARDS patients. the study was prematurely stopped because of poor patient accrual. there were no statistically significant differences in mortality or survival without supplemental oxygen. no worsening of exacerbation was observed in patients treated with IPV. the hospital stay was significantly shorter in the IPV group than in the control group (6.8 1.0 days versus 7.9 1.3 days; P 0.05). the remifentanil-based sedation regimen reduced the duration of mechanical ventilation by 53.5 hours. the remifentanil-based sedation regimen reduced the time from the start of the weaning process to extubation by 26.6 hours. piratory gas volume independent of ventilation represents poorly or nonventilated gas volume. about one-third of the total gas volume was poorly or OV = high-frequency oscillatory ventilation; IAP = intra-abdominal pressure; ICU = intensive care unit; IPAH = intrapulmonary percussive ventilation; PCP = pulmonary capillary pressure; PEEP = positive end-expiratory pressure; SARS = severe acute respiratory syndrome; VAT = ventilator-associated tracheobronchitis.
